WorkItem.ClosedComment: You are using old data, follow the instructions for clearing your silverlight cache
WorkItem.Description:
Whenever I try to go to the Rawr page on EJ using Firefox, I get the following error:
---------------------
Error Deserializing the Item Cache
Function:ItemCache.Load(...)
Error Message: There is an error in XML document (9195, 12).
Inner Error Message: Instance validation error: 'ShieldofRighteousness' is not a valid value for Trigger.
Info: No Additional Info
Stack Trace:
  at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize(XmlReader xmlreader, String encodingStyle, Object events)
  at System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializer.Deserialize(TextReader textreader)
  at Rawr.ItemCacheInstance.Load(TextReader textreader)
---------------------
When this error pops up, Firefox isn't necessarily locking up, but it won't let me click on the "OK" in the error window, and I can't do anything else with Firefox while the error window is still up, so I have to close Firefox from the task manager. I can load it fine in IE, but ew, gross, IE.
 
Vitals: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.10) Gecko/20100914 Firefox/3.6.10
Adblock/Noscript are installed, but I disabled them while trying to diagnose the problem with no improvement.
 
I realize it's a couple versions out of date (currently on 3.6.13).... I apparently stopped an update download without realizing it and have since resumed it. But it's really not that far behind that it should be catastrophically failing like this, and I don't know whether you guys are really the LATEST BROWSER OR GTFO crowd or the kind of people who realize people use different versions of different browsers all the time.
WorkItem.Summary: Firefox: Error Deserializing the Item Cache
